texts.en: Nasreen, age 47, is a married woman and mother of four. She has a business of sewing clothes. She is helping her husband in generating more revenue. She is well familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of the Kashf foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.  Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 10,000 to buy stock of threads in different colors and packs of buttons and needles. With this, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors and packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Paraíso en Guayaquil.  Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y artículos para el hogar.  Labora sola y no posee horario fijo.  No es casada, pero tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal del lugar.  Con el préstamo hará la compra de los útiles escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the neighborhood of Paraíso in Guayaquil. She sells cosmetics and household goods. She works alone and does not have a set schedule. The borrower is not married, but she has two children who are studying at a state school in the area.

With this loan, she will buy school supplies for her children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 48 años, nació en Colombia pero salió en busca de oportunidades y seguridad personal, está casado con Amalia de 41 años quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos de 12 y 9 años. Luis ahora vive en el Pacto una parroquia del Cantón Quito ubicado en la Provincia de Pichincha en la República del Ecuador. Pacto está ubicado en el noroccidente del Distrito Metropolitano de Quito, su historia inicia en la época preincaica y su nombre se deriva de acuerdos realizados entre partidos políticos importantes. En cuanto a su economía, es una zona agrícola y ganadera, debido a su situación climática y geográfica, lo cual también produce efecto en las cosechas de las cuales se obtiene productos de la Región Costa como de la Región Sierra. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Luis desde hace 20 años se dedica a la siembra, cosecha, tratado y venta de la caña de azúcar y sus derivados, actividad que la aprendió cuando era empleado particular y luego ya con la experiencia necesaria, se independizó y éste ha sido el sustento para su familia durante todos estos años, es por esto que invierte al menos 9 horas cada día y Luis comenta que una de las tareas más complicadas es cortar los troncos de la planta porque son muy sólidos, esta actividad la realiza en un terreno que es alquilado pero él sueña con un día poder tener su propia finca para así ofrecer a su familia un mejor estilo de vida. Es por esto que para cumplir este sueño Luis es consciente de que debe trabajar duro y cada día mejorar su labor, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en reparar y dar mantenimiento a la maquinaria que posee con la cual extrae el jugo de la caña con el que luego se elabora el azúcar y algunos derivados extras. Además este préstamo también le ayudará a adquirir algunas herramientas que le hacen falta para la cosecha de este fruto. Luis buscó muchas veces formas de obtener financiamiento, pero no le fue posible, sin embargo Fundación Alternativa le abrió las puertas y recibió el apoyo personalizado no solamente de su ejecutivo de crédito sino también de Kiva quienes apoyan mucho al emprendedor. Luis agradece a los inversionistas que decidan aportar con el negocio de él, pues significa mucho que personas de otros países decidan confiar en los sueños de una persona como él.
texts.en:
Luis is a 48-year old man.  He was born in Colombia, but he left in search of opportunities and personal security.  He is married to 41-year old Amalia, who focuses on household chores and the care of their 9- and 12-year old children.  Luis now lives in Pacto, a parish of the Quito canton, situated in the province of Pichincha in the Republic of Ecuador.  

Pacto is situated in the northwest of the Metropolitan District of Quito.  Its history begins in the pre-Incan period, and its name is derived from the agreements made between important political parties.  In terms of its economy, it is a farming and cattle raising region because of its climatic and geographic situation, which also have an effect on the harvests from which produce is obtained from the Costa region as well as the Sierra region.

Its people live day to day from these activities.  Although it is far from the city, there are families who have undertaken all types of businesses to meet their needs and those of their community.

For the past 20 years, Luis has made his living planting, harvesting, processing and selling sugarcane and its derivatives, a business he learned when he was a private employee.  Later, with the necessary experience, he broke away, and this has been the daily bread for his family for all these years.  This is why he works at least 9 hours each day.

Luis comments that one of the most complicated tasks is cutting the trunks of the plant because they are very solid.  He carries out this activity on rented land, but he dreams of one day being able to have his own farm, so that he can offer his family a better life.  It is in order to realize this dream that Luis is aware that he has to work hard and each day improve his work.  

This is why he is applying for a loan, which he will invest in repairing and maintaining his machinery with which he extracts the juice from the sugarcane, with which he later makes sugar and other derivatives.  Moreover, this loan will also help him acquire some tools which he needs for harvesting this fruit.

Luis searched many times for ways to obtain financing, but it was not possible.  Nevertheless, Fundación Alternativa opened doors for him and he received personalized help, not just from his loan officer but also from Kiva, who give the entrepreneur lots of support.  Luis is grateful to the investors who decide to contribute to his business, because it means a lot when people from other countries decide to trust in the dreams of a person like him.

loans.use: to repair and buy tools and machinery for his work.

loans.name: Maka Group

texts.en:
These are the five members of the Maka group. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sana`a. The whole group took out a loan of 290,000 YER. Nouria is the leader of a group. She is 37 years old. She is a tailor who sews fabrics, veils, scarves and various clothes. She has four children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Nouria`s most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her business structure. She is receiving a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy a sewing machine for her business. In the future, she would like to save her profit to own a house.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario de 52 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maíz, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Mario está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y así poder  tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Mario is 52 years old. He has worked in agriculture for several years. He grows corn and beans. With what he gets from selling his crops he is able to cover his household expenses. He is a responsible, honest and hardworking man. He lives with his wife and children. Mario is asking for a loan to be able to buy materials for his crop, such as fertilizer, manure, seed, etc. because what he earns isn't enough to cover his expenses. This way he can have better income and more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María de 47 años  vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, doña María es una mujer dedicada a su labor, luchadora siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, herramienta, etc. doña María está segura que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Maria is 47-years-old and lives with her life partner and their children. She works in agriculture, specifically maize and sorghum. She has worked many years in this field, which has provided her valuable experience that allows her to get the best crops. The cultivated land is located in an agricultural catchment area. She trades in all the surrounding areas and has a lot of regular clients. These people always prefer her product because it is good quality and sells at affordable prices.  Additionally, the service is unmatched. Maria is a woman dedicated to her work, a fighter always ready to work hard to achieve success. She wants to tap the growth of her business to increase production so she can have better profits. 

She need to invest in capital inputs so she is requesting a loan from Integral that allows you to buy seed, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, tools, etc. Maria is sure that she can pay off  her debt on time, and is also confident that she can give her family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, tools, etc

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.en:
Geronimo is 52 years old, married and blessed with three children. They live harmoniously in the village of Ugad. He's in the farming business, and he's requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, manure, and insecticides. 

The challenges he faces as of now are pests and plant diseases. His dream is to buy a piece of land and earn more income to give his family a good life. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, manure, and insecticides

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has happily been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. She purchases animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, raises them,  then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more goats. 

Naseem is on her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Yabom

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Yabom from Port Loko. She is married with three children between the ages of 9 years and 16 years. Her children are currently going to school. Her husband's income is not enough to support the home.

Yabom sells items at her house; she sells cigarettes, milk, Pure Water and alcohol. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business throughout the week from morning till night.  Yabom says that at present she is faced with insufficient capital to expand her business.

Yabom has requested a loan in order to buy more Pure Water, alcohol and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more Pure Water, alcohol and drinks.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 23 years old, married and lives with her husband, mother and grandfather in the town of Kutaisi.  Shorena works at a beauty salon as a hair stylist and gets a monthly salary. Her husband is a loader, her mother is a teacher, and her grandfather is provided with a retirement pension.  All the family members have their income, but the amount of the monthly sources is not enough to cover everyday expenses.  

So, Shorena decided to start a clothing sales business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Shorena’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn’t satisfy their requirements. She received this credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Startup Program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

With the loan of 1300 USD, Shorena will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell it in her community door-to-door.  Her regular customers will be her co-workers and neighbors.  She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children.  It is obvious that the job is hard for Shorena, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela  es una señora soltera de 30 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo de 7 años en el Caserío Chirij- Cruz, Aldea Xejuyup Nahualá, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la compraventa de ropa típica como cortes y güipiles, esta actividad lo realiza en diferentes comunidades de la boca costa específicamente en Nahualá e Ixtahuacán. Ella aprendió esta labor hace 5 años y es como de esta manera puede obtener ingresos y ganancias que contribuyen a la economía de su familia.
Ella  solicita un préstamo de Q 3,200.00 para la compraventa de ropa típica obteniendo mejores ganancias atreves de lo que realiza.
Su sueño es incrementar sus ganancias para poder ampliar su negocio y así  buscar más clientes para adquirir este producto ya que de esta manera podrá ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 30 year old woman. She lives with her 7 year old son in the community of Chirij- Cruz, Atown of Xejuyup Nahualá, Sololá. She buys and sells traditional clothing, such as skirts and güipiles. She does this activity in different communities of the boca costa, specifically in Nahualá and Ixtahuacán. She learned this work 5 years ago and that is how she can earn income and earnings that contribute to her family's finances.  

She is asking for a loan of Q 3,200.00 to buy and sell traditional clothing and earn better income through what she does. Her dream is to increase her earnings to expand her business and thus seek more customers to acquire her product, since this way she can help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a 23-year-old vigorous lady. She started a business stitching clothes a year ago. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Mente Positiva Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mente Positiva  está en su segundo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, tiene 17 miembros, pero en este ciclo solo 16 retiran de un crédito. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como medio de ayudar a estas mujeres, y tres de ellas están con ingresos muy bajos.
La Sra. Elvira, es la presidenta, ella es una líder que guía a sus compañeras y las alienta a seguir creciendo y mejorando día a día. Ella tiene una librería bien surtida, en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, ya que a esa hora hay muchos estudiantes que compran de ella.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de lápices, marcadores, cartulinas, libros, y demás insumos para poder surtir su librería y seguir luchando por mejorar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group named Mente Positiva  is in its second cycle of the women's committee program. It has 17 members, but in this cycle only 16 are getting a loan. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey as a way to help these women, and three of them have very low income. 

Elvira is the president. She is a leader who guides the other members and encourages them to keep growing and improving day to day. She has a well stocked bookstore where she works every day starting in the very early hours, because that is when a lot of students buy from here. 

She is asking for this loan to buy pencils, markers, cardboard, books, and other materials to be able to stock her bookstore and keep fighting to improve and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy pencils, markers, cardboard, book, and other materials.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  “Maria Auxiliadora 2” está en su Segundo Ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas. Tres de ellas integrantes se encuentran con ingresos muy bajos, pero están trabajando por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jorgelina, quien está en un nivel bajo de ingresos, pero es consciente de que debe seguir trabajando para mejorar sus ingresos. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados de todo tipo, está creciendo y trabajando de mejorar por medio de lo que hace. Es muy luchadora y por sobre todo entusiasta por salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  más variedad de calzados, Suecos, Zapatillas, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "Mary Helper 2" is in its second cycle of the program committee of women. They are taking the poverty elimination survey to determine the status of each of them. Three of these members have very low income, but they are working to get ahead.

One of the members, Jorgelina, is in a low-income bracket, but she is aware that she must continue to work to improve her income. She sells all kinds of shoes. She is growing and working to improve through what she does. It is very tough and above all enthusiastic to get ahead.

Jorgelina is requesting this credit to purchase a greater variety of shoes such as clogs, slippers, and items that will help her realize your business plan, which will help to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clogs, slippers, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five bales of secondhand shoes

loans.name: Mujeres Del Este Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Mujeres del este está en su ciclo número uno, ellas están con la esperanza de trabajar juntas, capacitarse e ir mejorando sus vidas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación en que cada una se encuentra y así ir mejorando en las áreas que necesitan.
Evangelista es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es muy trabajadora, y tiene muchas ansias de crecer y salir adelante. Su meta es poder seguir ayudando a su familia e ir creciendo con su emprendimiento. Ella está muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le permitirá seguir creciendo y continuar con las ventas de perfumes que hace.
Solicita de este crédito para poder  comprar más fragancias para poder venderlo, y de esa forma seguir creciendo con su microemprendimiento y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This group called “Women of the East” is in its first cycle. They are hoping to work together, train together, and keep improving their lives. They are doing the survey of poverty elimination to understand each person’s situation and this way improve in the areas of need.

Evangelista is one of the members of this group. She is hardworking and has a strong desire to grow and succeed. Her goal is to continue helping her family and grow with her business. She is grateful for this opportunity she is getting so that she can continue to grow and continue selling her perfumes.
She is requesting this loan to buy more fragrances in order to sell them, and thus continue to grow her microenterprise and helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase fragrances and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Mariatu from Port Loko. She is married with two children between the ages of five and ten years old. One of her children is currently going to school.  

Mariatu runs a general store at her house; she sells soap, milk, pure water, soda and biscuits. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Mariatu says that her business is going well because she started with small amount through BRAC.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to buy more soap, milk, pure water and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soap, milk, pure water and drinks.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es:
Palmira es artesana, una mujer con mucho talento, que esta creciendo y saliendo adelante gracias a que es muy hábil en lo que hace. Este es su segundo crédito en Kiva, y el anterior lo utilizo para comprar hilo, color y otros insumos que utilizo para hacer sus artesanías.
Hoy solicita de un nuevo crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos, hilos de colores, agujas y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías y seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Palmira is an artisan, a woman with much talent, who is growing and moving forward thanks to the fact that she is very skillful in what she does. This is her second Kiva loan, and the previous one she used to buy thread, dye, and other supplies that she used to make her crafts. 

Today she is requesting a new loan to be able to invest in the purchase of thread, colored thread, needles, and further supplies to be able to continue making her crafts and continue growing as she has been.

loans.use: to buy thread, colored thread, needles, and further supplies.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and blessed with six children. The two youngest are still in school.

Loice runs a cafe where she mainly sells cooked food to her customers. She also has a motorcycle which carries people for short distances and earns her extra money. Competition and high taxes levied by the authorities are her major business-related challenges.

Loice joined Milango with the purpose of accessing credit so she would be able to expand her business operations. She took out a previous loan and was able to repay it without difficulty. She now seeks a 41,900 KES loan to buy beans and charcoal.

Loice wants to make sure that she can pay the fees for her two youngest children’s education. With the extra profits she will make because of her loan, she should have no problem with this.

loans.use: to buy beans and charcoal.

loans.name: Rev Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is single, 20 years old, and does not support anyone else.  He provides motorcycle services and has been in the business for the past two years, earning himself an income of 15,000 KES monthly.

He is now receiving a loan of 30,000 KES. This is his first loan and he wishes to use this amount to purchase spare parts and do general service to his motorbike. The profits he earns will be used to purchase a new motorcycle and will enable him to expand his current business.

His dream is to see his business expand.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 34-year-old married woman. She is involved in the business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She has two cows which she uses for selling milk to the people of her community. She also makes butter and cheese with this milk, and she generates extra revenue. She looks after the cows and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. They feel pleasure while doing this business because it is to secure their children’s future. She has four children, and she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make more profits, she requested for a loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase another cow. In this way, she will be able to inflate her sales and profits simultaneously.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en: Kishwar is a 29-year-old married woman. She is involved in the general store business with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. He assists her by purchasing the stock of goods from the market and by dealing with customers. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and they make enough to meet the expenses of the family members. Currently, Kishwar requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demands at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Awab Group

texts.en: This group is called Awab. It consists of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. The members of the group are very trustworthy, responsible, and hardworking. The whole group took out a loan of 120,000 YER. Nadra is the group leader. She is a 38-year-old married woman, who lives in Aden. She has been operating a business of clothing sales for one year. She works very hard to improve the future for her children. She is happy to work from home and is always looking for ways to provide new and better services to her customers. She requested a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB which she will use to buy dresses, robes, fabric, and raw materials so that she can provide her customers with a wider selection and a better quality product. In the future, she hopes to continue working and have a good professional career.

loans.use: to buy dresses, robes, fabric, and raw materials so that she can provide her customers with a wider selection and better quality product.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy is a 22-year-old engaged man who has been working as an electrician since 2009. 
He is well known in the region for his special talent and the high quality of work he provides, in addition to his quick responses when asked for a certain service.
He is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy newly released tools to help with his business development. He will invest part of the loan, along with a small saved amount, to start building his dream house.

This is Eddy's third loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and he has a good standing repayment history. His previous loan helped him greatly in paying for his engagement expenses and in allowing him to save a small amount of cash from his business income to start building his dream home.

He is willing to keep on improving his business and to open a special electrician services company in the future.

loans.use: to buy newly released tools

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en: Noureen is 48 years old and a married, vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. By this time, she has managed a good client list, but due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch up more dresses timely. She is hopeful to increase her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits to provide a better standard of living for her six children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser, 26 years old, is from Gaza. He is married and has one child. He has owned a photography studio since 2010.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a professional digital camera for his studio. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a professional digital camera for his studio

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of three sons. She is doing a business of ‘waan’ manufacturing Waan is a thread-like material used in making charpoy (a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). She offers various types of ‘waan’ in different colors and has become famous for providing good quality material in her community. She operates the machine at home with the help of her husband. They are contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. In order to expand her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy another machine to make ‘waan’ with good quality thread to increase her sales. It’s her third year with Kashf foundation and she hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy another machine to make ‘waan’ with good quality thread.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, 23, is an enthusiastic married young woman. With the support of her husband, she has been actively involved in selling bedding for a number of years. She purchases a wide variety of bed and sofa covers in bulk and sells them to the people of her community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers Shazia is applying for a 25,000 PKR loan through Kashf to buy a greater variety of bed covers, spreads and sofa covers in different colors and designs. (This is her second year with the Kashf Foundation.) She wishes to spend part of her income on an expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy bed and sofa covers to sell

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Carmen es un grupo ejemplo, está en su noveno ciclo del programa de comités, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza donde 3 de las señoras están con ingresos muy bajos, pero eso les ayuda a querer luchar más y salir adelante.
Una persona digna de destacar es Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de verduras. Por medio de su trabajo ella trabaja y trata de mantener a su familia, también mejorar su negocio e ir creciendo. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que quiere seguir creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, como ser tomate, cebolla, locotes, papas y demás para seguir con sus ventas. El grupo está muy agradecido por esta oportunidad de crecimiento que esta teniendo.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen group is an exemplary group - it is in its ninth cycle of the committee program. They are engaged in the survey for the elimination of poverty; three of the women have very low incomes, but this helps them to want to struggle harder to get ahead.

One person who deserves to be highlighted is Maria, who works selling vegetables. Through her job she works to support her family and also to improve her business and continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. She is seeking part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables like tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables so that she can continue with her sales.

The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell, such as tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Hermaton

texts.en:
Hamerton lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. He is 64 years old and the father of nine children. For the last five years he has sold timber. He started his business with some savings he had put away. Bad debts and late payments are the major business-related challenges he faces.

Hamerton knew of Milango through friends, so he decided to join and access its credit to fund his business. He is applying for a 21,050 KES loan to buy a grinding machine to enable him to serve more customers in need of that service.

Hamerton’s ambition is to help other people start and run their own businesses.

loans.use: to buy a grinding machine

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 52-year-old man from a place known as Lubao, located in Kakamega, Kenya. He supports four people in his family as he is married with four children who are 23, 19, 17 and 13 years old respectively.

Tom is a carpenter who makes various furniture He has been doing this for the last 23 years and gets a monthly income of 20,000 He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase timber and other materials like nails, and paints He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his son.

His dream is to expand the business and to have a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more timber and other materials.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en: Rizwana is a 25-year-old vigorous lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues to generate a healthier source of income. Rizwana expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the revenue on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en: Dzame lives in Kilifi, Kenya. She keeps dairy cattle on her farm and sells roofing materials. She is 52 years old, married and blessed with five children. She started her businesses through her own personal savings and she is doing great. In the next five years, she hopes to open a retail shop and posho mill. She seeks a loan to buy a piece of land. The major challenges she faces is her customers not paying on time and the weather affecting her so much.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 28-year-old lady from the Kakamega region, which is found in the western part of Kenya She supports four people in her family She is married to Fedinand who is also a businessman from the same region They are blessed with one child who is six years old.

She has been selling second hand clothes for the last six years  She has been operating this kind of business and gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to boost her business by purchasing more stock of second hand clothes in bales. She she will plow the anticipated profit back into the business.

Her dreams and hopes are to expand the business and help her family with any needs.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is married and a responsible mother of three children, all of whom are married; one among them works as an electrician. Her family’s source of income depends on their farming activities and a retail business, which she operates from her house in a small village of Kompong Cham province. She has been doing in these businesses since 1999, from which she is able to cover her daily costs.

Sam has been a good client with HKL for six loans already. The loan she is asking for will enable her to cover the tuition fee of her child who is studying to be an electrician in a vocational training center. Also, she will use a portion of the loan to buy merchandise to sustain her retail business. She is grateful and confident to pay back the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fee of her child who is studying to be an electrician in a vocational training center.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is her husband who assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good, quality food as well as clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Kafiya

texts.en: Kafiya, age 32, is running a business of making and selling "gol gappay" with the support of her husband. She makes delicious "gol gappy", which is a dish consisting of a round, hollow puri fried crisp and filled with a mixture of flavored water ("pani"), chili, potato, onion and chickpeas. It is generally small enough to fit completely into one's mouth. She is an expert in making them at home while her husband sells them on his cart to the people of their locality.  In order to inflate her sales, she needs to purchase stock of flour, chickpeas and spices, so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of the revenue on providing a quality education to her four children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of flour, chickpeas and spices.

loans.name: Al-Shaby Group

texts.en:
Al-Shaby is a group consisting of six ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB. 

Mriam is a 45-year-old married woman who has five children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. She lives with her family in bad conditions. She would like to complete her building, but she suffers from a lack of money. So, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for building her house. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for building her house.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 63, is from the Usenge region within Kisumu, Kenya. He supports a large polygamous family and has three children who are 26, 22 and 18 years old.

For the past twenty years Michael has reared poultry which he sells to local hotels and other businesses. His sales generate a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Michael is applying for a 55,000 KES loan through KADET LTD to buy chicken feed and other poultry supplies. He is planning to use the anticipated profits to buy more chicks to raise and sell.

Michael’s dream is to stabilize his business and take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and other poultry supplies

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 54 years old and a farmer. She is married to Kariuki; they are blessed with three children. Nancy has been practicing farming for the past five years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which she uses to support her family. 

Nancy is applying for her fourth loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs as well as pigs.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will improve on the living standards of her family.

Her hopes and dreams are to improve on the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and buy pigs.

loans.name: Wilbrodah

texts.en:
Wilbrodah, 36, is married and has four children who are seventeen, fifteen, thirteen and nine years old. She lives in Shienwe in Vihiga County, which is located in the Kakamega part of Kenya.

For the last eleven years Wilbrodah has operated a beauty salon and comfortably generates a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She is applying for a 30,000 KES loan through KADET LTD to buy a hair drier and processing lotions to help her run her business. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

Wilbrodah’s dream is to become an outstanding businesswoman in the region and ensure a bright future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a hair drier and processing lotions

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: After graduating primary school, Patience decided to set up her own orange business in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over 10 years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more oranges for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a construction worker) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their seven children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges for resale.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en: Eusebia is 32 years of age. She is a business lady, a wife and a mother of one. She runs a beauty salon in Mombasa, Kenya where she also resides.  She has done this business for the last eight years. She started the business with the help of her parents, and she now seeks funds to connect electricity in her new place of work. She also wants to buy some weaves and wigs to resell. She knew Milango through friends, and she joined to fulfill her dream of running a successful beauty salon. Her challenge in this business is the weather. When it rains, she experiences a very low number of customers. She wants to save for future, unseen difficulties that may emerge. The extra income that she will raise from the loan use will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to install electricity at her new business premises.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman and a mother of six children from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. Rosalia has engaged in a motorcycle transport business with her husband for more than 10 years now. 

Rosalia is asking for a loan to buy tires, chains, nuts and bolts. With this, they will be able to improve and maintain the working condition of their motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy tires, chains, nuts and bolts

loans.name: Zenel

texts.en:
Zenel is a single young man who owns his own pharmacy located in a town in southeastern Albania. “I’m happy with my job because through it, I get to connect with and help people. I also like the clean and neat type of working environment. So, altogether this is the right type of the job! In my town, I am the only one who runs this activity, so I was able to get a good number of clients to begin with. Having no competition, it made it easier for me in the beginning to attract clients, but afterwards I had to be on top of my services so that I keep them happy. I guess now that they are as happy with my services as I am serving them,” Zenel stated with a smile on!

Zenel wants to stock up on pharmaceutical inventory items and this loan will enable him to achieve what he is looking for. “I wanted to say thanks in advance to all potential lenders,” Zenel said ending his interview with the loan officer.

loans.use: To stock up on pharmaceutical inventory items

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred lives in Kilifi, Kenya. He is 53 years old, married and blessed with nine children. For the past ten years he has operated a dairy. He bought his first cow with a loan he got through a co-operative society. He then went on to establish himself in dairy farming.

  During the dry seasons there is a scarcity of grass for his animals, and this shortage reduces their productivity. The weather, then, is his main challenge as a dairy farmer.

Winfred learned about Milango through his friends and decided to join. He is applying for a 52,250 KES loan to buy another dairy cow. Any extra income that he raises will be put into savings. He has ambitions of buying more cattle and supplying milk to the entire county.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a 32 years old from Homabay town which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports seven people in her family and is married to Mr. Ouko. She has six children who are 13, 12, 12 (twins), 7 and 2 years old respectively.

She has a retail shop within the town center. She has been operating this business for the last five years and gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more items like sugar, tea leaves and salt for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. Her dream is to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, tea leaves and salt for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Veronica did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Veronica sells clothes in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about five years. As a single mother with three children, Veronica uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Veronica will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of clothes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Veronica wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of clothes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.es:
Cayetano es un señor de 34 años, está casado hace más de 5 años con la Sra. Tomasa de 27 años, es un hombre muy trabajador que lucha por poder ayudar a su familia.
Hace años empezó con una pequeña despensa en su casa, donde su señora atiende mientras que él sale a comprar animales para faenarlos y venderlo en la despensa. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando toda la familia junta en la despensa y ya cuentan con clientela formada gracias a todo el trabajo que su familia en conjunto hace.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar animales para faenar, y de esa forma seguir con las ventas de carne en su despensa. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Cayetano is a 34 year old man, and has been married for more than five years to Tomasa, who is 27 years old. He is a very hardworking man who strives to support his family. Several years ago, he started a small grocery store in his house, which his wife runs while he purchases animals to butcher and sell in the store. Currently, the entire family works together in the store and has a solid customer base thanks to all the work the family does as a group. 

Cayetano is requesting this loan in order to purchase animals to butcher, and thus continue selling meat in his store. He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase animals to butcher.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is involved in selling second-hand clothing in Adentem (near Cape Coast). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a cleaner) support their two children. She has been involved in selling second-hand clothing for four years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of second-hand clothing, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her second-hand clothing enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of second-hand clothing, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity.

loans.name: Em El Ezz

texts.en:
Em El Ezz is a 65-year-old married mother of three children. She is of Egyptian origin and is married to a Lebanese man.

Em El Ezz has been working in agriculture since nine years ago; she sells vegetables and has a small convenience store at her house.

Em El Ezz is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for her lands' reclamation and to buy new seedlings to develop her business. Her husband also works as a farmer, but their combined revenues aren't enough to cover their family's expenses; that's why she has to work hard to help her husband in supporting their family's socioeconomic situation.

She is willing to develop her home-based business through diversifying her store's products to meet customers' needs.

loans.use: to perform land reclamation and to buy new seedlings to develop her business.

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.es:
El Sr. Ladislao  tiene 57 años, está casado con la Sra. Jorgelina, el se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de ladrillos común, negocio mediante el cual la familia completa se mantiene y tienen para poder salir adelante.
El crédito que solicita es para poder invertirlo en la compra de leñas en cantidades para que su producción no se vea afectada por la falta de dicha materia que utiliza en sus hornos de cocción de sus ladrillos.                                                                   
 Agradece a la fundación paraguaya y kiva por la ayuda que está recibiendo, por la confianza y el apoyo que le brindan, que gracias a eso producirá lo suficientes para asegurar el ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Ladislao is 57 years old and married to Jorgelina. He earns a living by producing and selling clay bricks, a business which supports the entire family and allows them to get ahead. 

The loan he is requesting is to purchase firewood in quantities such that his production won't be affected by a lack of firewood, which he uses in his brick firing ovens. 

He is grateful to the Paraguay Foundation and Kiva for the help he is receiving and for the confidence and support they give him. Thanks to this, he will produce enough to ensure income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to use in the production of bricks.

loans.name: Ruksana

texts.en: Ruksana is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She is a vigorous lady and has been running a business of cloth sales for many years. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors, designs from the market at wholesale rates, and after doing stitching, sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Ruksana is requesting a loan of 35,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members. She dreams to open her own boutique shop to display her work.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 40-year-old single man who has been working as a musician since thirteen years ago. He plays drums, is very talented in this domain, and puts so much effort into pleasing his listeners with special released music to add pleasure and happiness to their lives. Wissam works hard to keep his instruments updated, and that is why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy newly released, updated musical instruments to add to his stock. Music is his life, and he hopes to spread it worldwide. Through increasing his stock of instruments, he is taking his first step forward toward opening his private studio.

loans.use: to buy newly released, updated musical instruments to add to his band.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат жительница села района Шахритус. Она 46-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее одна взрослая дочь. Шарофат вместе с дочерью работает в столовой официанткой. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках за пределами страны. Шарофат очень усердная и энергичная женщина. Одновременно она занимается выращиванием крупно-рогатого скота. Она закупает, откармливает и перепродает скот в течение 4-х лет. Шарофат научилась выращивать скот у своей бабушки. Сейчас она хочет увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота. Она запрашивает кредит для закупа трех голов коров и телят.
texts.en: Sharofat is a resident of the Shahrituz region. She is a 46 year old married woman. She has one grown daughter. Sharofat and her daughter work together as waitresses in an eatery. Her husband is working abroad at this time. Sharofat is a very diligent and energetic woman. Simultaneously she also grows large horned cattle. She buys, feeds and resells the cattle for four years. Sharofat learned to grow cattle from her grandmother. Right now she wants to increase the headcount of her cattle. She is asking for a loan to buy three heads of cows and calves.

loans.use: to buy and resell large horned cattle.

loans.name: Soliha

texts.ru: Солиха добросовестная и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 сыновей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. С целью получения дохода она более 10 лет занимается скотоводством. Солиха является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж Рустам является строителем и имеет сезонную работу. Солиха имеет в обороте 4 голов крупно – рогатого скота и 5 голов мелко – рогатого скота. Солиха и ее семья живут в сельской местности, в старом доме. Солиха планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Однако она не имеет денег. Ее дети выросли, и они нуждаются больше комнаты и поэтому ей необходимо перестроить некоторые комнаты для того, чтобы сделать просторным пространство жилья. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Soliha is an honest and purposeful woman. She is 49 years old. She is married and is raising three sons. Her children are also adults. To earn income she has been doing animal husbandry for over ten years. Soliha is the sole provider for the family because her husband Rustam is a construction worker and has only seasonal job. Soliha has four heads of large horned cattle and five heads of small horned cattle. She and her family live in the rural area in an old house. Soliha plans to repair her house, but does not have money. Her children have grown up and needs bigger rooms and that's why they need to rebuild some of the rooms to make a more spacious living space. She is asking for a loan for an amount of 10,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood and paint. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood and paint to repair the house.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Джамила была очень счастливой женщиной. Однако 5 лет назад ее муж умер, и она осталась без кормильца. Джамила данное время живет в сельской местности со своими детьми. Она имеет 3 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. После смерти мужа ей было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами. Но постепенно дети стали помогать ей по введению бизнеса. Она более 26 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она занимается скотоводством. Джамила в обороте имеет 4 голов крупно – рогатого скота. Джамила покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. На местном рынке она имеет своих клиентов. Она хочет провести мероприятие у себя дома, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Jamila was a very happy woman. However five years ago her husband has passed away and she has been left without the provider. Jamila lives in a rural area with her children at this time. She has three children and they are adults. After her husband's death it was very hard for her to deal with family expenses. But gradually her children began to help her in running of the business. She has been running her own business for over 26 years. She does animal husbandry. Jamila has four heads of large horned cattle. She buys the cattle, feeds it for several months and then sells it on the local market. She has regular customers. She wants to hold a party at her house, but does not have money. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 somini to hold the event. She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to make a party for her family.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en: Tariq is 22 years old. He is single and lives in Mafraq, Jordan with his family that consists of 17 members. He is currently in his 4th year studying a Bachelors of History. Tariq is planning to work in his field of study in the future after graduation. But as he is facing financial problems, he is requesting a loan that covers his study fees.

loans.use: to pay for his study fees.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married to a driver. She has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a junior high school graduate, Florence currently operates a grocery store in ADENTEM (near Cape Coast). With over three years of experience in this trade, Florence sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more groceries to sell, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Florence wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her grocery enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Benkelema I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BEKELEMA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  33 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à WORODA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz avec SALI  debout devant les autres en mouchoir rouge  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  FAKOLA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 190.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Bekelema I group are married women with an average age of 33 and, on average, 3 children, who all live in polygamous families in Woroda, one of the villages in Fakola, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Sali, standing in front of the others in the picture and wearing a red headscarf, grows rice. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 2 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Fakola to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 190 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay labour wages.

loans.name: Benkelema Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BEKELEMA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à WORODA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz avec SENE 1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 185.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Bekelema II group are married women with an average age of 32 and, on average, 3 children, who all live in polygamous families in Woroda, one of the villages in Fakola, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Sene, standing on the left in the picture, grows rice. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 2 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and at the market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 185 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay labour wages.

loans.name: Benkelema Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BEKELEMA III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  26 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à WORODA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec NABINTOU 1ère assise à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de  FAKOLA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 190.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Bekelema III group are married women with an average age of 26 and, on average, 3 children, who all live in polygamous families in Woroda, one of the villages in Fakola, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Nabintou, sitting on the right of the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 2 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and at the Fakola market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 190 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay labour wages.

loans.name: Qamile

texts.en:
Qamile sells clothes as shown in the picture and she’s been doing this for almost nine years. Qamile says:  “This type of activity has helped my family tremendously. I had two children who then were 14 and 11 years old to feed and educate, and by selling clothes I earned an okay income. I widowed around that time and this activity became the only financial income for us. Nothing much, but not bad either. The store is located in a city, so, more demands for what I sell. I remember at first, when my husband past away, I immediately thought that there was no other ways around, but just to suffer. Living in a poor country, it is difficult to find jobs but very soon the reality hit me and I had to find one and quickly also. I was fortunate enough to start selling clothes."

Qamile is applying for a loan of 300,000 Albanian lek to stock up on inventory items.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a widow and has four children. After successfully graduating primary school, Patience is now an established businesswoman. She sells clothes and diapers in ADENTEM (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about seven years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Patience uses her income to provide for the entire family. Patience will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of clothes and diapers, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Patience plans to diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of clothes and diapers.

loans.name: Aza

texts.en:
Aza is 54 years old. She lives in Tskaltubo District with her husband and a grown son. Aza requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family's poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is a small agricultural business. They have three milk cows and produce cheese which is sold locally. Their income is hardly enough for food for a three-member family. Aza requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business and build a greenhouse. 

Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of low income. With the loan, Aza will purchase all the building materials for the greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built properly, Aza will grow greens and various vegetables. The harvested products will be sold for a good price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family income and all members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is 28 years old from Gaza. She is married and has one child. She has owned a grocery store since 2008, and has one employee who helps her. She has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator and install display shelves for her grocery store. She hopes that this loan will help her increase the goods displayed and thus improve her income.

The one who appears in the pictures is Hanan's husband, since due to some cultural manners she refused to take a picture.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and install display shelves for her grocery store.

loans.name: Benkelema Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BEKELEMA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FLACODA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec FATOUMATA ALI 1ère debout à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 0.5hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  FAKOLA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 45.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Bekelema II group are married women with an average age of 32 and, on average, 3 children, who all live in polygamous families in Flacoda, one of the villages in Fakola, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 6th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Fatoumata Ali, standing on the far right of the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Fakola to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 45 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay labour wages.

loans.name: Falada Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 5 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe FALADA vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Kolondièba (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce : poisons frais, de savons et de pagnes wax. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame DJELIKA (assise au milieu sur la photo) est la vendeuse de pagnes wax, de  parures, etc. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 pièces de pagnes wax et 2 colis de parures. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame DJELIKA compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Falada group is made up of 5 married women with an average age of 32 and, on average, 3 children, who live in traditional families. They all live in the town of Kolondièba (prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships and marriage. The group members are small retailers and sell items like fresh fish, soap and wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing).

The members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of increasing their businesses and are on their 3rd group loan cycle. Djelika, sitting in the middle of the picture, sells items like wax pagnes and clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy 5 wax pagnes and 2 packages of clothing. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers and makes her sales for cash or credit, door-to-door and at the market, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, Djelika expects to make an average monthly profit of 17 500 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to support her husband with some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy various items (wax pagnes and clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Bamougue

texts.fr:
BAMOUGUE est née en 1977 à Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elle  vie chez son époux avec leurs enfants à Kadiolo, dans une famille traditionnelle.
Elle mène des activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers tels que des tissus, la préparation et vente de jus de gingembre, de bisap, etc depuis plus de 7 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et elle reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, elle collabore avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso, il ya 3 ans. Après des prêts de groupe, tous bien remboursés, elle est à son premier individuel.   
Elle compte acheter 300 mètres de tissus et des ingrédients pour la préparation des jus (constitué de sucre, gingembre, bisap, arômes et sachets en plastique). Les ventes sont faites  au niveau du village de Kadiolo. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso en tissus et sur place en matière première pour la préparation des jus. Sa clientèle est composée pour la plupart de femmes et d’enfants. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de faire face au remboursement des échéances de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bamougue was born in 1977 in Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). She lives with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Kadiolo.

She has for the past seven years been buying and selling a variety of products such as fabrics, as well as preparing and selling ginger juice, bissap (a juice made from hibiscus flowers) and other juices. Her experience in this field has earned her a good reputation and she gets orders from a variety of customers. In order to have the necessary resources to meet customer demand she has been collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, for the past three years. After a number of group loans which were repaid in full, she is on her first individual loan.

She is planning to buy 300 meters of fabric as well as ingredients for the preparation of juices (made up of sugar, ginger, bissap, flavorings and plastic bags). She sells her products in the village of Kadiolo and gets her supplies of fabric in Burkina Faso and basic juice ingredients locally. Her customer base is made up principally of women and children.

With this loan, she expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA. This profit will enable her to meet her loan repayments and to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and ingredients for preparing juice.

loans.name: Paradise Group

texts.en: Ritha, who is in her late 20s, is single. She is a college student. For four years now, she has been running a cafe, selling various kinds of food, such as rice, snacks and soft drinks. She has ten helpers in her cafe who run all the café’s daily activities. She is a really hardworking girl, with more productive plans. She works from 3 am to 10 pm daily, and she is able to make an excellent profit per month. This is her second loan application to Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loan, which she repaid back successfully, she bought a popcorn machine, in order to attract more people. With the profit she earned,covered her own tuition fees and household expenses, and she also reinvested in the business. Ritha will use this loan to put electricity in her business premises. She dreams of expanding her business widely, one day. Ritha will share this loan with her Paradise Loan Group, which consists of 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to put electricity in her business premises.

loans.name: Koumatissa Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 5 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe KOUMATISSA vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 41ans et  5enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Kolondieba (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de poissons frais. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame MAIMOUNA (1ème assise à droite sur la photo) est vendeuse de poisson frais du groupe comme les autres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 kilos  de poisson frais.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Koumatissa group is made up of 5 married women with an average age of 41 and, on average, 5 children, who live in traditional families. They all live in the town of Kolondièba (prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and marriage. The group members are small retailers of fresh fish. The members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of increasing their businesses and are on their 3rd group loan cycle.

Maimouna, sitting on the far right of the picture, sells fresh fish like the other group members. She plans to use her loan to buy 100 kilos of fresh fish. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers and makes her sales for cash or credit, door-to-door and at the market, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, Maimouna expects to make an average monthly profit of 17 500 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to support her husband with some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Fatogoma

texts.fr:
