One example is Tiburcia who sells ‘chipas’ [cheese buns], a traditional Paraguayan food that’s sold year-round.  She says that she does well with her sales; thanks to her skills she has many customers.  She helps her family and is gradually improving her income more and more.

Today, she’s requesting this loan to be able to buy chipas to continue with her sales, improve her income and thus grow.

loans.use: to buy "chipas" [cheese buns].

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is 21 years old and lives at Paynesville North which has the largest local  market in Montsorrado. She and her fiancé live together. Her finance is not working. They have three children between 2 and 6. Two are in school and they all live at home. May describes herself as a hard-working lady. Since 2012, she has been running a table market where she sells pepper, palm oil, bitter ball, etc. in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways her customers respond to it. She started this business with money given to her by her oldest sister. She walks to buy her inventory since her market table is close to the local market. She sells from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. six day a week. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, palm oil, bitter ball, etc. for her business. She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a shop. She thanks the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, palm oil, bitter ball, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Arnulfo De Jesús

texts.es: Arnulfo es un señor de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 19 años de edad. Desde que era pequeño siempre ha vivido en el campo, lugar donde su padre le enseño las labores agrícolas y de ganadería. Por falta de educación no le fue fácil conseguir oportunidades de empleo, debido a que no sabe leer, ni escribir, su única opción fue emplearse como reciclador en una chatarrería, donde labora hace ya 12 años; adicionalmente y para complementar sus ingresos, cuenta con algunas vacas lecheras y ganado de levante al que cría y cuida sobrepasando los obstáculos que se le presentan debido a que los insumos agrícolas son muy costosos y el precio de venta de la leche disminuye constantemente, generando una inestabilidad económica y una difícil situación en su hogar. Por este motivo, Arnulfo busca apoyo con el tercer ciclo de crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca productora de leche y una ternera de levante, con el fin de aumentar su producción y poder mejorar los ingresos por las ventas, esto le ayudará a cumplir el sueño de salirse de su empleo como reciclador y dedicarse a su familia y al cuidado de sus animales, de esta forma podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia y brindarle a su hijo, la oportunidad que él nunca tuvo por falta de recursos… Educación.
texts.en: Arnulfo, 43, lives with his wife and his 19-year-old son. From a young age, he has always lived in the countryside, where his father taught him about farming and ranching. Due to a lack of education, it was not easy for him to find work opportunities. Because he does not know how to read or write, his only option was to be employed as a recycler at a scrapyard, where he has worked for 12 years. To complement his income, he has some dairy cows and breeding cattle that he raises and cares for, overcoming obstacles that present themselves, since farm supplies are expensive and the sale price of milk is constantly going down, which creates economic instability and a difficult situation in his house. This is why Arnulfo is asking for a third loan to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow and a weaned calf, with the goal of increasing production and improving his income through sales. This will help him achieve his dream of leaving his recycling job and dedicating himself to his family and caring for his animals. This way, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life and give his son the opportunity that he never had due to a lack of resources...education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a weaned calf.

loans.name: One Word Group

texts.en:
Massah is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Massah is 31 years old and was born in Kenema city. She is married to a trader and the couple has 2 children one who is attending primary school and the other secondary school. Massah sells rice, pepper, etc. and has been in this business for many years now. 
With the help of this loan, Massah and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Massah is going to use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy rice and pepper in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice and pepper in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca es cliente antigua de la fundación, vive en la ciudad Luque, es una persona muy trabajadora, que se está esforzando por el sustento de su familia, comenta que tiene una una despensa  desde el año 2009.
También comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que luego, por medio de su esfuerzo pudo ir mejorando y creciendo, y poco a poco ir agrandando su negocio.
El préstamo que solicita lo quiere invertir en la compra de insumos de su despensa, como ser bebidas, golosinas, yerba, lácteos, etc. y obtener de esa manera mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Con esto obtendrá mejor margen de ganancias en su negocio, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida y la de toda su familia.-
texts.en:
Francisca is a long-standing Fundación client.  She lives in the city of Luque and is a very hardworking person who is striving to support her family; she comments that she’s had a grocery store since 2009.

She also comments that she started out with very little but then by means of her effort was able to improve and to grow and to gradually enlarge her business.

She wants to use the loan she’s requesting to buy supplies for her store like beverages, snacks, herbal tea, dairy products, etc. thus obtaining a wider variety of goods to offer her customers.  With this, she’ll earn a better profit margin which will help her improve her and her entire family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mamoud S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of hard-working and dedicated teachers has applied for a loan of SLL 19,700,000 for the entire group in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Mamoud is the featured leader of this group. Born in Portloko, Mamoud is married to a trader. He has nine children in his name, five of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Mamoud has been a school teacher for many years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials for the completion of a dwelling house he had begun constructing.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials for the completion of a dwelling house he had begun constructing.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius’ colleagues in the food service industry always told him that, with his passion for taking care of people and his talent for cooking, he should open his own catering company. After years of working in kitchens and cooking for various restaurants, Julius has finally opened his own home-based catering service. 

With four employees and a list of clients, Julius now needs money to get his business off the ground. This loan will allow Julius to lease a kitchen and a vehicle, and to buy necessary equipment, including: speed racks, hot boxes, cooking utensils, and chafing dishes. Julius hopes to one day expand his business to eventually be able to open soup kitchens in his local Miami community to serve those in need.

loans.use: to lease a kitchen space and vehicle and to purchase necessary kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Marina, a sus 26 años de edad, es una mujer que con empeño y dedicación realiza las actividades agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres; desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de esterillas para caballo y gracias a todo ese tiempo que lleva laborando en esta actividad, ha logrado ser reconocida en el pueblo donde vive y sus alrededores, teniendo la oportunidad de ofrecer su producto a muchos clientes y adquirir dinero y recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia. La titular es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, lo demuestra con el arduo trabajo que realiza a diario y además quiere preparar un terreno para sembrar cultivos de plátano, yuca y ñame, pero le hacen falta unos insumos, por lo cual solicita el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (semillas, abono, pesticidas, fungicidas), así complementará su negocio y podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos, incrementará sus ingresos y esto le permitirá cumplir el sueño de ampliar sus cultivos y brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar y estabilidad económica para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marina, aged 26, is a woman who carries out the agricultural tasks with endeavor and dedication, as her parents have taught her. From an early age she has been selling horse mats and thanks to all the time she has spent doing this, she has gained a reputation in the village where she lives and its surroundings, giving her the opportunity to offer her products to a large number of clients, thus earning money and resources to help sustaining her family.

Marina is a very entrepreneurial person, visionary and with a strong desire for self-improvement, which she demonstrates by the hard work she carries out every day. She also wants to prepare a piece of land for cultivating plantain, cassava, and yam; but for this she needs inputs which is why she is applying for this loan. She wants to use it to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and fungicides. This way she can complement her business, offering a larger variety of products and increasing her income. This will help her to pursue her dream which is to amplify her crop farming and give her family more well-being and economic stability so that they can improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and fungicides

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sra. Angela es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es comerciante, y se dedica al macate (venta ambulante). Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha por su familia ya que quiere darles todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
El crédito solicitado fue para compra de insumos para la venta, como ser prendas, calzados, frazadas y demás para que de esta manera pueda recargarse. Aparte de esta actividad también trabaja en otros lugares para poder seguir mejorando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Ángela’s from the city of Carapeguá.  She works selling merchandise from place to place.  She’s a very hardworking person who strives for her family because she wants to provide everything they need so they won’t have to go through any lacks.

The loan requested was used to buy merchandise to restock with items like clothes, shoes, blankets, etc. to sell.  In addition to this activity she also works in other places in order to continue improving and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, blankets, etc.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El Señor Adolfo es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es una persona muy trabajadora, cuenta que tiene un lavadero de motos y autos en la comunidad de San Ignacio.
El es una persona que lucha por salir adelante, dar a su familia lo que necesitan, y de esa forma no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
El opto por el crédito con la Fundación para invertirlo en la compra de una manguera a presión para la parte de lavado de motos, ya que por la gran afluencia de gente ya está teniendo, lo está necesitando para ir mejorando su local y así poder tener mayor cantidad de clientes y también realizar con mayor agilidad los trabajos.
texts.en:
Adolfo’s from the city of San Ignacio.  He’s a very hardworking person.  He says he has a car and motorcycle washing service in the community of San Ignacio.

He’s a person who strives to get ahead and give his family what they need so that they will not have to go through any privations.

He opted for a loan from the Fundación to buy a pressure hose for the motorcycle washing because he’s been having a high volume of customers and he needs it in order to improve his locale and be able to handle a larger number of customers and also to do the work more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy a pressure hose.

loans.name: Miriam Amparo

texts.es: Miriam es madre cabeza de familia, pues tiene 6 hijos por los que ha luchado para sacarlos adelante sola. Actualmente ella se dedica a atender su negocio, ubicado en una zona muy transitada de la región donde vive, allí ofrece variedad de productos de la canasta familiar como lácteos, pan, galletería, huevos, cárnicos, gaseosas, entre otros, con lo cual obtiene recursos para llevar el sustento diario a su familia. Es una señora organizada, responsable y muy trabajadora, a pesar de las dificultades económicas por las que ha pasado, no se detiene, siempre busca opciones para salir adelante, por eso se motivó para solicitar su primer crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido para su negocio (huevos, lácteos, productos de aseo, mecato, gaseosas) para poder tener disponibilidad y variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y así incrementar las ventas, para que sus ingresos mejoren y poder brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y buena educación.
texts.en:
Miriam is head-of-household; she has six children she strives to move forward alone.  She currently works tending to her business located in a very busy sector of the region she lives in.  She offers there a variety of basic staple items like dairy products, bread, cookies and crackers, eggs, meats, soft-drinks, etc. with which she earns income to provide her family with daily sustenance.

She’s a well-organized, responsible and very hardworking woman who despite the economic difficulties she’s had does not stand still and always seeks options to get ahead.  This is what motivated her to request her first loan to buy stock merchandise for her store (eggs, dairy products, cleaning supplies, packaged snacks, soft-drinks) to have a variety of goods on-hand to satisfy customer needs thus increasing sales so that her income will improve and to be able to provide her children with better quality of life and good education.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh is 40 years old and lives at Paynesville North, which has the largest local market in Montsorrado. She’s married and her husband is not working right now. They have three children, between 10 to 4 years old, who are in school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past four years she has been selling rice, pepper, toothpaste, etc. in the local market. She likes her business because of the way customers respond to it. Kebbeh started this business with money given to her by her mother, which she earned by the means of shard taxi that enables her get her goods to her table at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, toothpaste, pepper, etc. for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia in enabling small business owners to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Dry Fish Seller Association Group

texts.en: Mariama is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariama is 32 years old and was born in Kenema city. She is married to a teacher and the couple has 2 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Mariama sells dried fish and has been doing this business for many years now. Together, they have applied for a loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to add more inventories into their respective businesses. This will lead to more sales and profit and will consequently improve their standard of living. Featured leader Mariama will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy baskets full of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy baskets full of dried fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Amunafa Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Amunafa” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Isatu is the featured leader of this group. She is 32 years old, married to a businessman, and they have 4 children. Isatu has been a businesswoman for 5 years now. She sells toothbrushes, toothpaste, soap, body spray, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the aforementioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy toothbrushes, toothpaste, soap, body spray, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Andon

texts.en:
Three years ago, Andon was just returning from a six-month long backpacking journey through Mexico, with a mission to learn the on-the-ground truth about sustainable forestry and reforestation. During his trip he managed to forge his first partnership with Taller Leñateros, an art which consists of printing and publishing their own books about the Tzotzil Maya on recycled paper. Upon returning home, he took action by recruiting a team of interns to help him start his business, New Forest Earth. 

New Forest Earth operates like a business (selling unique products from indigenous cooperatives) as a way to raise funds for the charitable work (indigenous cultural development and rainforest conservation). On his website, clients can purchase the different products imported from the Americas but also donate in order to help the organization. 

Andon values the support of his over fifty volunteers and interns who continue to help him with website design, marketing, and finance and accounting. To learn more about how New Forest Earth helps people make a living from healthy forests, visit http://www.newforestearth.org/.

loans.use: to buy natural products from two of the most successful cooperatives in Mexico

loans.name: Sing

texts.en:
Sing is originally from Hongkong, where he spent many years working as a steel ship builder. After relocating to the United States, he started his own business 28 years ago. 
 
Pro Design and Construction does full build-outs for food industry businesses, and his craftsmanship can be seen all around Boston, from Kendall Square to Back Bay. Most of his operations take place on site with his pickup truck but he also has a small workshop. His work is characterized by exposed natural woods and sleek, modern designs that elevate fast food to a more elegant level. 

Sing Yin's credit was damaged last year when a contract fell through in the middle of his work. Although he has managed to pay off his entire debt, this loan with Accion will help him to start building back his credit and to have some working capital - a constant challenge for contractors.

loans.use: to build his credit and obtain some working capital

loans.name: Limber

texts.es: Limber, de 45 años, está casado y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Limber es la agricultura, se dedica específicamente al sembrío de plátanos, tiene un terreno de 15 hectáreas que le heredaron sus padres para que pueda desarrollar un oficio que le permita obtener sus propios ingresos económicos. Trabaja 20 años en la siembra de este producto y lo realiza con ayuda de 4 personas quienes lo apoyan en todas las funciones de campo. La producción actual que obtiene de su cultivo le genera las ganancias económicas suficientes para sobrellevar los gastos básicos que se presentan diariamente, sin embargo considera que no es suficiente para poder invertir en otros negocios o para aumentar la extensión de siembra ya que en ocasiones este cultivo se ve afectado por las intensas lluvias o por demasiado viento. Se siente a gusto con su trabajo de campo pues lo considera una actividad sana y tranquila ya que no tolera la vida en la ciudad por los ruidos molestos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará abono orgánico para fortalecer la siembra de plátano.
texts.en:
Limber, 45, is married with five children he lives with in his own house.  The activity Limber carries out is agriculture, specifically growing bananas.  He has a 15-hectare parcel his parents passed down to him so that he could have an occupation that would allow him to earn his own income.

He’s worked growing this product for 20 years and he does so with the help of four people who help him do the field chores.  The current crop yield he obtains from his crop generates income sufficient to cover his basic daily needs.  However, he believes that it’s insufficient to be able to invest in other businesses or to increase the area he plants because this crop is occasionally affected by intense rainfall or too much wind.

He feels good with his work in the field because he considers it to be a tranquil, healthy activity since he does not tolerate life in the city because of the bothersome noise.  On this occasion he will request 2,000 soles and he’s grateful for the opportunity being provided to realize his work plan.  He will use the requested amount to buy organic manure to strengthen his banana crop.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Jovino

texts.es:
Jovino es de la ciudad de Ybycui, está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, quiere poder ser un gran abogado que pueda ayudar a las demás personas en lo que necesiten.
La meta de Jovino es poder terminar su carrera y luego empezar a trabajar en forma independiente y de esa forma poder ir creciendo no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo profesional, para poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases y también pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jovino’s from the city of Ybycui and is studying Law.  He’d like to become a great attorney that can help others who need him.  

Jovino’s goal is to finish his career and then start to work independently in order to grow that way not just economically but also professionally to help his family.

He requests this loan to pay tuition and fees.

loans.use: to pay university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima es de la Ciudad de Concepción,  está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial. Es una joven que está estudiando por salir adelante, y poder cumplir sus sueños.
Comenta que su meta es poder convertirse en un gran profesional para poder ayudar a su familia con su conocimiento.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y en sus gastos de titulación. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que será de gran ayuda apara ella.
texts.en: Fátima’s from the city of Concepción.  She’s studying Commercial Engineering.  She’s a young woman who is studying in order to get ahead and to be able to reach her dreams.  She comments that her goal is to become a great professional in order to help her family with her knowledge.  She requests this loan to pay tuition and degree fees.  She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to pay university tuition and fees.
